title: Trump Seeks Removal of Fed's Cook Over Dual Residence Allegations
snippets: Trump says he'll fire Fed governor Cook if she doesn't resign
President Donald Trump said Friday he will fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook if she does not resign from her position.
Federal Housing Finance Agency Director Bill Pulte accused Cook of mortgage fraud this week, alleging she claimed two properties as her primary address.
President Donald Trump on Friday stepped up his administration’s pressure campaign on Federal Reserve Gov. Lisa Cook, saying he’d try to remove her from her post if she didn’t step down.
titles: Trump says he'll fire Fed governor Cook if she doesn't resign - Axios
Trump says he'll fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook 'if she doesn't resign'
Trump Threatens To Fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook
Trump says he’ll fire Fed’s Cook. Why the Supreme Court might block such a move.
summary: President Donald Trump announced he will attempt to remove Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook from her position if she does not resign. This statement follows accusations by Federal Housing Finance Agency Director Bill Pulte, who alleged Cook committed mortgage fraud by claiming two properties as her primary residence. Trump's demand intensifies his administration's pressure on Cook.

title: NBA's Malik Beasley Cleared in Federal Gambling Probe
snippets: Malik Beasley is no longer a target of the federal gambling investigation conducted by the Eastern District of New York, his attorneys told ESPN on Friday, potentially reopening free agency for one of the NBA's top shooters.
Beasley was the latest NBA player investigated for irregular activity on prop bets

titles: Beasley no longer target of gambling investigation
Malik Beasley's attorneys say he's no longer target of federal gambling investigation and not charged
NBA Free Agent Malik Beasley Not a Target in Federal Gambling Probe, Attorneys Say - Sports Illustrated
summary: Malik Beasley, an NBA free agent, is no longer under investigation by the Eastern District of New York for federal gambling, as confirmed by his attorneys to ESPN. This development clears him from the probe into irregular prop bet activities and potentially revitalizes his opportunities in free agency.

title: Supreme Court Backs Trump Admin in Cutting DEI-Linked Grants
snippets: Supreme Court lets Trump slash DEI grants at NIH&nbs
Supreme Court sides with Trump on cutting government grant programs involving diversity, equity and inclusion.
The ruling also blocks the policy behind their termination.
titles: Supreme Court lets Trump slash DEI grants at NIH - Axios
Supreme Court says Trump may cancel DEI-related health research grants
Deeply divided Supreme Court lets NIH grant terminations continue
summary: The Supreme Court, in a 5-4 decision, sided with the Trump administration to cut government grant programs that involve diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI), impacting areas such as breast cancer research and HIV prevention. This ruling upheld a lower court's decision to invalidate National Institutes of Health (NIH) memos enforcing these policies, potentially leading to the loss of NIH grants worth hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: UN Declares Famine in Northern Gaza Amid Ongoing Conflict
snippets: Famine has been officially declared in northern Gaza, a U.N.-backed group warns — marking the first such confirmation in the Middle East.
The UN-backed IPC has found that Gaza now faces famine after 22 months of Israel's war on the Palestinian territory.
UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says Gaza famine is a 'man-made disaster', calls for immediate action.
More than half a million people in and around Gaza City are facing catastrophic conditions “characterized by starvation, destitution and death,” the IPC said.
titles: Famine confirmed in northern Gaza, says U.N.-backed agency
What has led to a famine being confirmed in Gaza?
Famine confirmed in northern Gaza, global hunger monitor says
Famine confirmed in Gaza City region, global hunger monitor says
summary: The U.N.-backed Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) has officially declared a famine in northern Gaza, marking the first confirmation of famine in the Middle East. This crisis comes after 22 months of conflict between Israel and the Palestinian territory. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres described the situation as a 'man-made disaster' and called for immediate action. The IPC reports that over half a million people in and around Gaza City are experiencing catastrophic conditions, including starvation, destitution, and death.

title: Waymo Gets Approval to Test Autonomous Vehicles in NYC
snippets: Waymo is getting one step closer to starting its engine in New York City.
Waymo has gotten the green light from New York City to start testing autonomous vehicles on its streets.
It's the first permit of its kind, and a crucial step along the path toward launching a true robotaxi service in the Big Apple.
titles: Waymo granted first permit to begin testing autonomous vehicles in New York City
Waymo just got approval to start testing its self-driving vehicles in New York City
Waymo approved to start autonomous vehicle testing in New York City
summary: Waymo has received approval from New York City to begin testing autonomous vehicles, marking a significant milestone as the first company to obtain such a permit in the city. This development is a key step towards the potential launch of a robotaxi service in New York City.

title: Orioles Sign Basallo to Record 8-Year Catcher Contract
snippets: Basallo's contract is the largest ever given to a catcher with similar service time
Samuel Basallo has yet to hit a home run in MLB, but the Baltimore Orioles have seen enough to lock up the young catcher to an eight-year extension.
The Baltimore Orioles are looking to lock up one of their core pieces for the long term.
titles: Samuel Basallo extension: Orioles catcher signs historic eight-year, $67 million pact days after MLB debut
Basallo Signs An Extension With The Orioles After Just Four MLB Games
Report: Orioles, catcher Samuel Basallo finalizing long-term extension
summary: The Baltimore Orioles have signed catcher Samuel Basallo to an eight-year contract extension, the largest ever for a catcher with his level of service time in MLB. Despite not having hit a home run in the league yet, the Orioles have committed to Basallo as a key part of their team's future.

title: Ontario Gov Appeals Court Ruling on Toronto Bike Lane Removal
snippets: Premier Doug Ford's government has formally filed a notice of appeal challenging a court ruling deeming its plan to tear out dedicated bike lanes in Toronto unconstitutional.

Premier Doug Ford’s government is appealing a recent Ontario Superior Court decision that struck down its plan to remove bike lanes on three major Toronto streets, calling the ruling “the most ridiculous” he’s ever seen. The court found the province’s legislation — whic
titles: Ford government formally appeals ruling deeming Toronto bike lane removal unconstitutional
Ford government appeals court ruling on Toronto bike lane removals
summary: The Ontario government, led by Premier Doug Ford, has filed an appeal against an Ontario Superior Court decision that found its plan to remove dedicated bike lanes on three major Toronto streets unconstitutional. The court's ruling, which Ford described as "the most ridiculous" he's ever seen, challenges the province's legislation aimed at dismantling the bike lanes. The appeal represents the government's formal response to protect its legislative agenda.

title: Erik Menendez Denied Parole 36 Years After Parents' Murder
snippets: Menendez, along with his brother Lyle, has served 35 years of a life prison term for fatally shooting their parents.
Erik and his brother Lyle were convicted of the killings and sentenced to life without parole in 1996. Lyle's parole hearing is set for Friday.
'Seeing my crimes through my family’s eyes has been a huge part of my evolution and my growth,' Erik Menendez said during his nearly 10-hour hearing.
titles: Erik Menendez denied parole, decades after killing parents
US: Erik Menendez denied parole after parents' murder
Erik Menendez denied parole after decades behind bars
summary: Erik Menendez, convicted alongside his brother Lyle for the murder of their parents in their Beverly Hills home in 1989, was denied parole at his first hearing since their sentencing to life without parole in 1996. The decision came 36 years and one day after the crime. Erik is eligible to reapply for parole in three years, while Lyle's parole hearing is scheduled for Friday.

Additionally, SportsLine's Projection Model and CBS Sports experts have released their best bets for Friday's major games, including specific picks for the Week 0 matchup between Kansas State and Iowa State, among other games.

title: Fed Chair Warns Tariffs May Fuel Inflation, Slow Jobs at Jackson Hole Event
snippets: Central bank chair warns of ‘challenging situation’ with tariffs pushing up inflation and jobs market cooling
The Federal Reserve chair gave prepared remarks at the Fed’s annual economic symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.
titles: Powell says ‘shifting’ economic risks strengthen case for Fed rate cut
Powell says ‘shifting balance of risks’ may warrant a sooner rate cut
summary: The Federal Reserve chair expressed concerns about tariffs increasing inflation and slowing job growth during the annual economic symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyoming. The chair highlighted a challenging situation due to these factors.

title: Thailand's Ex-PM Thaksin Acquitted of Royal Defamation Charge
snippets: Thailand's former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra was acquitted of a royal defamation charge by a court on Friday, in a case that could have sent him to prison for up to 15 years.
Retired politician and billionaire businessman was accused of violating Thailand's strict laws on insults to royalty.
titles: Thai court acquits ex-Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra of royal defamation charge
Court clears Thailand’s ex-PM Thaksin Shinawatra in royal insult case
summary: Thailand's ex-Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra was cleared of a royal defamation charge that could have led to a 15-year jail term. The case involved allegations of violating Thailand's laws on insulting the monarchy. The court's decision acquitted Thaksin Shinawatra of the charge.

As the 2025 NFL season approaches, these insights come after the Eagles' victory over the Chiefs in the last Super Bowl, highlighting the anticipation for new fantasy football drafts.

The Federal Reserve is gearing up to resume cuts to interest rates, its chair,
titles: Stocks surge after Powell signals rate cuts ahead - Axios
Fed chair Jerome Powell signals interest rate cuts amid Trump attacks
summary: Stocks surged following Federal Reserve Chair Powell's signal of impending interest rate cuts. Powell, despite being urged by Trump to resign, discussed the economic risks posed by tariffs and other challenges. The Federal Reserve is preparing to lower interest rates to address these issues.

summary: Toronto Maple Leafs forward William Nylander expressed doubts about reports suggesting his former teammate, Mitch Marner, had plans to leave the team last season. Nylander indicated he wasn't convinced Marner was considering a departure, implying Marner's intentions to stay with the team.

The High Court rejected Clarke's claim, finding the accusations credible and ruling in favor of the newspaper. The judgment highlighted Clarke's lack of credibility as a witness.

title: Nottingham Forest's Santo Hints at Tension with Co-owner, Job at Risk
snippets: It seems unfathomable, but heres why Nuno Espirito Santo might be on his way out the door less than two weeks into the new season

Nuno Espirito Santo says his relationship with Nottingham Forest co-owner Evangelos Marinakis is "not the same" and admits "where there's smoke, there's fire" in response to reports his position at the club is under threat.
titles: Nottingham Forest miracle worker Nuno Espirito Santo on the hot seat: 'Where there's smoke, there's fire'
Nuno says 'where there's smoke, there's fire' as Marinakis relationship deteriorates
summary: Nuno Espirito Santo, the manager of Nottingham Forest, has hinted at tension with co-owner Evangelos Marinakis, acknowledging a change in their relationship and suggesting there is truth to rumors his job is at risk. This comes less than two weeks into the new season, indicating potential instability within the club's management.

title: Perseverance Rover Studies Mars' Wind-Shaped Megaripples
snippets: On Mars, the past is written in stone—but the present is written in sand. Last week, Perseverance explored inactive megaripples to learn more about the wind-driven processes that are reshaping the Martian landscape every day.

Written by Athanasios Klidaras, Ph.D. candidate at Purdue University On Mars, the past is written in stone — but the present is written in sand. Last week, Perseverance explored inactive megaripples to learn more about the wind-driven processes that are reshaping the Martian landscape every day.  Af
titles: To see the world in a grain of sand: Investigating megaripples at Kerrlaguna on Mars
To See the World in a Grain of Sand: Investigating Megaripples at ‘Kerrlaguna’
summary: Perseverance rover recently examined inactive megaripples on Mars to study the wind-driven processes that continuously alter the planet's landscape. This exploration aims to understand how the Martian surface is being reshaped by natural forces. Authored by Athanasios Klidaras, a Ph.D. candidate at Purdue University, the investigation highlights the dynamic environmental changes occurring on Mars.

title: Jones, Parsons' Agent Dispute Contract Talks; Harsh Words Denied

Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones continues to make it clear where he stands on contract negotiations with All-Pro linebacker Micah Parsons.

Cowboys’ Jones says there is no room for Parsons’ agent in negotiations
summary: Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones and Micah Parsons' agent are in disagreement over contract negotiations. Jones claims the agent used harsh words, a statement the agent denies to multiple outlets. The conflict highlights ongoing discussions about Parsons' contract with the Cowboys.

title: Firm Shifts Work to Europe, Boosts AI Investment Amid Safety Act Focus
snippets: The firm says it's planning to relocate work to its other offices in Europe and invest more in AI.
Moves comes despite Online Safety Act requirements on dangerous material
titles: TikTok to lay off hundreds of UK content moderators
TikTok to lay off hundreds of UK moderators as it shifts to AI
summary: A firm is relocating work to its European offices and increasing investment in AI, despite the Online Safety Act's focus on dangerous content. The decision indicates a shift in priorities towards technology and efficiency.

title: Health Secretary Ends Talks as Drugmakers Reject Offer, Rebate Scheme Stays
snippets: Wes Streeting terminates meetings after lobby group refuses to accept offer
Drugmakers fail to meet health secretary’s latest offer, meaning ‘unsustainable’ rebate scheme will stay in place
titles: UK health secretary ends talks with pharma groups on NHS drug pricing
Wes Streeting’s row with pharma firms grows as they reject NHS drug pricing offer
summary: Wes Streeting, the Health Secretary, ended discussions with a lobby group after they declined his final offer. As a result, the current rebate scheme, deemed 'unsustainable' by officials, will remain unchanged. This decision comes after drugmakers failed to agree to terms proposed by the health secretary.

title: Howe to Reintegrate Isak if He Stays Post-Transfer Window
snippets: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe says he will reintegrate Alexander Isak into his squad if the striker is still at the club beyond the transfer window.
Eddie Howe has admitted Newcastle are in a "lose-lose" situation over Alexander Isak but is confident the wantaway striker will be welcomed back by his team-mates if he remains at St James' Park.
titles: Isak saga 'lose-lose' but I'd welcome him back into squad - Howe
Howe: 'Lose-lose situation' with Isak - but he can win supporters back
summary: Newcastle manager Eddie Howe has stated that Alexander Isak will be reintegrated into the squad if he remains at the club after the transfer window. Despite describing the situation with the wantaway striker as a "lose-lose" scenario, Howe is confident Isak will be welcomed back by his teammates at St James' Park.

titles: Alina Habba "unlawfully appointed" New Jersey AG, federal judge rules - Axios
Judge says Alina Habba, Trump's top federal prosecutor in New Jersey, not lawfully appointed
summary: Alina Habba, previously a lawyer for Donald Trump and acting as the U.S. Attorney for New Jersey, was disqualified by a judge from overseeing a case. This decision came after criminal defendants challenged her authority, citing her appointment as "unlawful." The Trump administration has not adhered to a July ruling from a panel of judges that mandated replacing Habba as the interim U.S. attorney.

title: Brompton Announces September Distributions for ETFs and Funds
snippets: TORONTO, Aug. 22, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — (TSX: BAAA, BAAA.U) Brompton Wellington Square AAA CLO ETF announces distributions payable on September 15, 2025 to unitholders of record at the close of business on August 29, 2025 as follows: Ticker Amount Per Unit BAAA   Cdn$0.0910 BAAA.U   US$0.091

TORONTO, Aug. 22, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — (TSX: DGS, DGS.PR.A, GDV, LBS, LCS, PWI, SBC) – Brompton Funds announces distributions payable on September 15, 2025 to class A shareholders of record at the close of business on August 29, 2025 for each of the following funds:   Ticker Amount Per Shar
titles: Brompton Wellington Square AAA CLO ETF Declares Distributions

summary: Brompton Wellington Square AAA CLO ETF and Brompton Funds announced distributions payable on September 15, 2025, to their respective unitholders and class A shareholders of record as of August 29, 2025. For the Brompton Wellington Square AAA CLO ETF, the distribution amount is Cdn$0.0910 and US$0.091 per unit for its BAAA and BAAA.U tickers, respectively. The announcement also includes distributions for various Brompton Funds, although specific amounts per share were not disclosed.
